content:
3.35 
Rights and obligations of spouses in the household 
1. A spouse may not, without the consent of the other spouse, transfer, mortgage, lease or in any other way encumber the right to a movable object used in the family household. 
2. Household goods, furniture, except works of art, collections and home libraries, shall be regarded as movable property used in the family household. 
3. The spouse without whose consent the transaction was concluded has the right to have the transaction annulled if he or she did not approve the transaction after it was concluded, unless the transaction was for consideration and the third party was in good faith.
